Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • Board

  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    Creates a Board object which contains a playing field.
    Since:
    1.6
    Version:
    2013-1003
    Author:
    Tom Tilli

        public void printBoard(boolean visible)

        Prints the playing field.

      • setVisiblePlayingField

        public void setVisiblePlayingField(int posY,
                          int posX,
                          java.lang.String x)
        Sets a given String to the visiblePlayingField array.
        Parameters:
        posY - the Y axis on the board.
        posX - the X axis on the board. @ x the String to be added.

      • getVisiblePlayingField

        public java.lang.String[][] getVisiblePlayingField()
        Returns the visiblePlayingField.
        Returns:
        the playing field visible for the player.

      • setPlayingField

        public void setPlayingField(int posY,
                   int posX,
                   java.lang.String x)
        Sets a given string to the playingField array.
        Parameters:
        posY - the Y axis on the board.
        posX - the X axis on the board.
        x - the String to be added.

      • getPlayingField

        public java.lang.String[][] getPlayingField()
        Returns the playingField.
        Returns:
        the playing field invisible for the player.

      • getFieldPosition

        public java.lang.String getFieldPosition(int posY,
                                int posX)
        Returns the String from the playingField from a specific spot.
        Parameters:
        posY - the Y axis on the board.
        posX - the X axis on the board.

      • playerHasShot

        public boolean playerHasShot()
        Returns the boolean goToAITurn;
        Parameters:
        a - true or false stating if the AI can start its turn.

      • hitOrMiss

        public void hitOrMiss(int posY,
             int posX,
             Ship[] shipArray)
        Checks if a shot has hit a ship.

        Chances the ascii on the board to an X if there was a ship on the given spot and a ? if there wasn't.

        Parameters:
        posY - the Y axis on the board.
        posX - the X axis on the board.
        shipArray - an array of Ship objects to compare.

      • shipHit

        public void shipHit(int posY,
           int posX,
           Ship x)
        Lowers the deathCounter of a hit ship.
        Parameters:
        posY - the Y axis location of the shot.
        posX - the X axis location of the shot.
        x - the Ship which will have its counter decreased.

      • shipDeath

        public void shipDeath(Ship[] shipArray)
        Checks if a ship sunk after it has been hit.

        Takes a array of Ship objects and checks if any of then has got their deathCounter lowered to 0.

        Parameters:
        shipArray - the array of Ship objects to compare.

      • whichShipHit

        public Ship whichShipHit(Ship[] shipArray,
                int posY,
                int posX)

      • gameEnd

        public boolean gameEnd(Ship[] shipArray)
